skill.description: Runs tests and handles failures. Triggered when: test execution, verification, test failures, CI checks.

skill.author: 1gy

security_audit.summary: This is a test runner skill with standard development tool permissions. The Bash tool access is necessary for running test commands. No network access, no credential access, and no persistence mechanisms detected.

content.value_statement: Manually running tests and analyzing failures is time-consuming. This skill automates test execution across different project types, detects test commands, runs tests, and handles failures by implementing fixes.
actual_capabilities: Detects test commands based on project files (package.json, Cargo.toml, justfile, Makefile, pyproject.toml, go.mod)
Runs test suites and reports pass/fail status
Identifies failed test names and error messages
Analyzes failure causes to determine root issues
Implements fixes for implementation bugs and test bugs
Re-runs tests after fixes to confirm success
limitations: Does not modify complex multi-file test configurations
Cannot resolve external dependencies required by tests
Limited to projects with standard test command patterns

use_cases.title: Run test suites
use_cases.description: Execute project tests automatically with the correct command for your project type

use_cases.title: CI test validation
use_cases.description: Validate test execution in CI environments and diagnose failures quickly

use_cases.title: Verify test coverage
use_cases.description: Run tests to verify code changes pass all quality checks before merging

prompt_templates.title: Run all tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the tests for this project and tell me how many tests passed or failed

prompt_templates.title: Debug failures
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the tests, identify any failures, and explain what is causing them

prompt_templates.title: Fix and verify
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the tests, fix any failures, and confirm all tests pass afterward

prompt_templates.title: CI preparation
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the full test suite and fix any issues so the code is ready for CI checks

output_examples.input: Run the tests for this project
output: Test suite completed: 42 tests passed, 3 failed
Root cause analysis: test_payment_processing has a mock configuration issue
Fix applied: Updated payment mock to use correct API endpoint
All tests now passing after fix

best_practices: Run tests frequently during development to catch issues early
Use specific test commands when you need targeted testing
Review failure analysis to understand root causes before applying fixes
anti_patterns: Running tests without first checking the project configuration
Ignoring test failures and committing broken code
Applying automatic fixes without understanding the root cause

faq.question: What test frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Supports npm test, cargo test, pytest, go test, make test, and just test commands based on project files

faq.question: Can it run specific test files?
faq.answer: The skill runs the project's default test command. You can ask for specific test filtering in the prompt

faq.question: Does it work with CI systems?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works with any project that has standard test commands configured

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: Only project files needed to detect test commands. No sensitive data or credentials are accessed

faq.question: What if tests fail due to environment issues?
faq.answer: The skill distinguishes between bugs and environment issues. Environment problems are reported to you for resolution

faq.question: How does it compare to manual test running?
faq.answer: This skill automates detection, execution, and failure analysis. It saves time finding the right command and diagnosing issues
